fields.name: ENCHANTING_FUELS
fields.description: Controls what items can be consumed for enchanting such as Enchanting Tables. This tag defaults to Items.LAPIS_LAZULI when not present in any datapacks, including forge client on vanilla server

fields.name: BUCKETS_WATER
fields.description: Does not include entity water buckets. If checking for the fluid this bucket holds in code, please use FluidBucketWrapper.getFluid() instead.

fields.name: BUCKETS_LAVA
fields.description: If checking for the fluid this bucket holds in code, please use FluidBucketWrapper.getFluid() instead.

fields.name: BUDDING_BLOCKS
fields.description: For blocks that are similar to amethyst where their budding block produces buds and cluster blocks

fields.name: BUDS
fields.description: For blocks that are similar to amethyst where they have buddings forming from budding blocks

fields.name: CONCRETE_POWDERS
fields.description: Block tag equivalent is BlockTags.CONCRETE_POWDER

fields.name: CLUSTERS
fields.description: For blocks that are similar to amethyst where they have clusters forming from budding blocks

fields.name: DYED
fields.description: Tag that holds all blocks and items that can be dyed a specific color. (Does not include color blending items like leather armor Use ItemTags.DYEABLE tag instead for color blending items) Note: Use custom ingredients in recipes to do tag intersections and/or tag exclusions to make more powerful recipes utilizing multiple tags such as dyed tags for an ingredient. See DifferenceIngredient and CompoundIngredient for various custom ingredients available that can also be used in data generation.

fields.name: FOODS_FRUITS
fields.description: Apples and other foods that are considered fruits in the culinary field belong in this tag. Cherries would go here as they are considered a "stone fruit" within culinary fields.

fields.name: FOODS_VEGETABLES
fields.description: Tomatoes and other foods that are considered vegetables in the culinary field belong in this tag.

fields.name: FOODS_BERRIES
fields.description: Strawberries, raspberries, and other berry foods belong in this tag. Cherries would NOT go here as they are considered a "stone fruit" within culinary fields.

fields.name: FOODS_SOUPS
fields.description: Soups, stews, and other liquid food in bowls belongs in this tag.

fields.name: FOODS_CANDIES
fields.description: Sweets and candies like lollipops or chocolate belong in this tag.

fields.name: FOODS_EDIBLE_WHEN_PLACED
fields.description: Foods like cake that can be eaten when placed in the world belong in this tag.

fields.name: FOODS_FOOD_POISONING
fields.description: For foods that inflict food poisoning-like effects. Examples are Rotten Flesh's Hunger or Pufferfish's Nausea, or Poisonous Potato's Poison.

fields.name: GLASS_BLOCKS_CHEAP
fields.description: Glass which is made from cheap resources like sand and only minor additional ingredients like dyes

fields.name: HIDDEN_FROM_RECIPE_VIEWERS
fields.description: Tag that holds all items that recipe viewers should not show to users.

fields.name: MUSIC_DISCS
fields.description: For music disc-like materials to be used in recipes. A pancake with a JUKEBOX_PLAYABLE component attached to play in Jukeboxes as an Easter Egg is not a music disc and would not go in this tag.

fields.name: ORE_BEARING_GROUND_DEEPSLATE
fields.description: Blocks which are often replaced by deepslate ores, i.e. the ores in the tag ORES_IN_GROUND_DEEPSLATE , during world generation

fields.name: ORE_BEARING_GROUND_NETHERRACK
fields.description: Blocks which are often replaced by netherrack ores, i.e. the ores in the tag ORES_IN_GROUND_NETHERRACK , during world generation

fields.name: ORE_BEARING_GROUND_STONE
fields.description: Blocks which are often replaced by stone ores, i.e. the ores in the tag ORES_IN_GROUND_STONE , during world generation

fields.name: ORE_RATES_DENSE
fields.description: Ores which on average result in more than one resource worth of materials

fields.name: ORE_RATES_SINGULAR
fields.description: Ores which on average result in one resource worth of materials

fields.name: ORE_RATES_SPARSE
fields.description: Ores which on average result in less than one resource worth of materials

fields.name: ORES_IN_GROUND_DEEPSLATE
fields.description: Ores in deepslate (or in equivalent blocks in the tag ORE_BEARING_GROUND_DEEPSLATE ) which could logically use deepslate as recipe input or output

fields.name: ORES_IN_GROUND_NETHERRACK
fields.description: Ores in netherrack (or in equivalent blocks in the tag ORE_BEARING_GROUND_NETHERRACK ) which could logically use netherrack as recipe input or output

fields.name: ORES_IN_GROUND_STONE
fields.description: Ores in stone (or in equivalent blocks in the tag ORE_BEARING_GROUND_STONE ) which could logically use stone as recipe input or output

fields.name: RODS
fields.description: For rod-like materials to be used in recipes.

fields.name: RODS_WOODEN
fields.description: For stick-like materials to be used in recipes. One example is a mod adds stick variants such as Spruce Sticks but would like stick recipes to be able to use it.

fields.name: SHULKER_BOXES
fields.description: Block tag equivalent is BlockTags.SHULKER_BOXES

fields.name: STONES
fields.description: Natural stone-like blocks that can be used as a base ingredient in recipes that takes stone.

fields.name: STORAGE_BLOCKS
fields.description: A storage block is generally a block that has a recipe to craft a bulk of 1 kind of resource to a block and has a mirror recipe to reverse the crafting with no loss in resources. Honey Block is special in that the reversing recipe is not a perfect mirror of the crafting recipe and so, it is considered a special case and not given a storage block tag.

fields.name: TOOLS
fields.description: A tag containing all existing tools. Do not use this tag for determining a tool's behavior. Please use ToolActions instead for what action a tool can do.

fields.name: TOOLS_SHIELD
fields.description: A tag containing all existing shields. Do not use this tag for determining a tool's behavior. Please use ToolActions instead for what action a tool can do.

fields.name: TOOLS_BOW
fields.description: A tag containing all existing bows. Do not use this tag for determining a tool's behavior. Please use ToolActions instead for what action a tool can do.

fields.name: TOOLS_CROSSBOW
fields.description: A tag containing all existing crossbows. Do not use this tag for determining a tool's behavior. Please use ToolActions instead for what action a tool can do.

fields.name: TOOLS_FISHING_ROD
fields.description: A tag containing all existing fishing rods. Do not use this tag for determining a tool's behavior. Please use ToolActions instead for what action a tool can do.

fields.name: TOOLS_SPEAR
fields.description: A tag containing all existing spears. Other tools such as throwing knives or boomerangs should not be put into this tag and should be put into their own tool tags. Do not use this tag for determining a tool's behavior. Please use ToolActions instead for what action a tool can do.

fields.name: TOOLS_SHEAR
fields.description: A tag containing all existing shears. Do not use this tag for determining a tool's behavior. Please use ToolActions instead for what action a tool can do.

fields.name: TOOLS_BRUSH
fields.description: A tag containing all existing brushes. Do not use this tag for determining a tool's behavior. Please use ToolActions instead for what action a tool can do.

fields.name: ARMORS
fields.description: Collects the 4 vanilla armor tags into one parent collection for ease.

fields.name: ENCHANTABLES
fields.description: Collects the many enchantable tags into one parent collection for ease.
